content: As an avid film buff I'm surprised this movie slipped through the cracks for me until just recently. It caught my eye in the video store and I had heard good reviews, so I checked it out. I was simply amazed by this film. I've tried very hard not to grow cynical in this age dominated by Battlefield Earth's and teen film puke, and this movie gracefully redeems its entire decade. Wonderful performances all around the board, terrific script, and intelligent directing and cinematography. I've so missed the classic films of the earlier eras, and I love that L.A. Confidential was able to recapture the cinematic genius of that time. A film for those who truly love films.

title: Outstanding movie
content: Kim Basinger's performance is outstanding. This is what a 10 star movie should be. All the actors in this did an amazing performance. If you like Kim Basinger this is her best movie performance.

title: Righteous Detectives Against Corruption!
content: Crime suspense set in Los Angeles in 1953. LAPD detective Bud White finds Lynn, a prostitute in a prostitution ring, as he investigates the brutal murder of 6 people, including a former detective. Meanwhile, ambitious Ed Exley, whose father was a detective killed in the line of duty, and Jack Vincennes, an adviser on TV detective shows, have their own agendas. They clash, but eventually join forces to confront corruption within the police.First and foremost, the film is an excellent depiction of the conflict and growth between Russell Crowe's character, Bud White, and Guy Pearce's character, Ed Exley. Bud is a misfit and disobeys orders. Ed, on the other hand, is an honors graduate of the police academy. They have very different personalities, but their common sense of justice gradually brings them together.The direction is superb. The dark visuals and tense scenes that beautifully recreate the atmosphere of 1950s Los Angeles took my breath away.

title: one of the best film of the decade
content: first of all i read in this page some people being confused over the fact if L.A Confidential was Film Noir or not ,Answer to that question is it'e a Neo noir . It is a very self aware, One of the the best of it's kind it's in the same league as The ChinaTown .The performance are excellent , starting from Russel crowe to Danny devito. This movie once again proved the unfairness of Oscars since none of the male leads were nominated for the awards.The story is very good .Everything about this movie is just awesome . if you haven't watched yet just go ahead and watch it , i can assure you that it would be one of you're best movie watching experience . enjoy

title: Very Fun Crime Movie with Great Acting and Pacing
content: Super fun crime story that I don't regret watching. It's not one of those movies with the most unexpected plot or twists, it comes very little closer to Tarantino's style, and the actors play their roles perfectly. Guy Pearce is phenomenal. Not just him de, but he got in my head the most it seems :)I recommend it to everyone - there's a bit of everything in this film. It's maybe a bit brutal at times, but that brutality somehow passes and is easy to watch. The pacing of the film is top notch, I have no quibbles with it.So if you get a chance - watch it; super chilled out and interesting. Not the greatest masterpiece, but definitely something to see :)Final score: 7/10.

title: Keep it confidential and never tell me.
content: When I first saw the commercial for this movie, I was interested to see it. When people were buzzing about how good it was, I was really interested.After seeing it, I simply shrugged. I thought it was very boring and I didn't think Kim Basinger was that great. Although I liked Crowe and Spacey in this, I didn't like any of the others like Divito and Guy Pearce. After all the oscar stuff, I even saw it again and still nothing.To this day I still can't think what is so great about it or remember any scenes that really stick out. It reminds me of another really dumb and idiotic movie called Forrest Gump. I am glad Titanic beat this pile of rubbish.0/10

title: A true modern classic
content: This great throwback to cop/gangster flicks of the golden age is a wonderfully realised treat for fans of the genre and all movie lovers, featuring a gang of top stars on blistering form, working from a brilliant script under very classy direction. Shades of noir classic Touch of Evil hang over this cracking thriller (check out the oil pumps pounding away in the background in the finales of both films), dealing with moral and political shenanigans in the LAPD and the movie-star-and-drug-baron milieu of Marlowe and Sam Spade. Spacey, Crowe and Guy Pearce head a brilliant cast that includes great turns from Danny DeVito, Kim Basinger and James Cromwell, all caught up in a fantastically complex web of corruption and crime that unravels itself beautifully as the film builds to its pounding climax. At heart though this is a moral picture looking at the pursuit of justice in an ethically complex world, and a buddy picture about tough men overcoming their differences to pull together towards a common goal of good over evil. A great soundtrack of period tunes and a few deft touches of humour put the finishing touches on a film that comes pretty near perfection.

title: A good solid movie...............
content: L.A. ConfidentialDIRECTION % Film noir style.ACTING % All the characters are great except for perhaps the female support.EDITING/SPECIAL EFFECTS % Generally good.PLOT % The strongest part of the movie.
